repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - Social Assistance System
            Modernization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Assistance System
            Modernization Project for Ukraine were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately unsatisfactory; risk to development outcome
            was high; Bank performance was moderately satisfactory and
            borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned includes: financing of Information
            Analytical System for Social Assistance (ASSAP) operations
            should be secured to ensure sustainability. Multiple
            contingency plans should be made in case primary financing
            fails to materialize. Some of the costs could be covered by
            other budgets, such as funds allocated for the
            administrative functions of the Ministry of Social Policy
            (MOSP) or the social centers; even external donor funding
            may be a source for the MOSP to explore. Procurement methods
            affect the development process. Implementation of any kind
            of uniform system across a country with great variance in
            local capacity and attitudes requires strong oversight and
            control mechanisms at the central level. Currently, the
            Ministry is lacking virtually any capacity to coordinate
            activities with the regions and local welfare offices and to
            oversee their implementation, which needs to be taken into
            account by any follow-up operations. Sustainability of
            software, hardware, and knowledge to use the equipment must
            be addressed before and during implementation. Arrangements
            should be made at the outset of the project to ensure
            financing of equipment maintenance. A cost/benefit analysis
            will ease the process of securing funding for system
            operations, maintenance and further development. Using
            internal country systems where appropriate is a useful
            cost-saving measure and can help in building capacity.

repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - Social Assistance System
            Modernization Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Assistance System
            Modernization Project seeks significant improvement of the
            effectiveness of Ukraine's social assistance system by
            better targeting the benefits and reducing the burden on
            beneficiaries. The changes concern reallocation of proceeds
            of the Project from the category two 'subvention for
            modernization of local social welfare services' to the
            category one 'goods, works and services (other than
            consultants' services), consultants' services
            training, study tours, and operational costs'. The
            Borrower requested the reallocation of proceeds on the
            ground of significant saving of funds under category two.
            All renovation works under this category have been completed
            and the amount left is sufficient to cover in full all the
            contractual amounts due. Meanwhile, a need to increase the
            funds under category one arose. In order to implement a new
            data processing system of the social assistance system in an
            all-inclusive format and provide necessary hardware and
            software to the most distant Labor and Social Assistance
            Offices additional financial resources are required.

display_title.display_title:
Ukraine - Social Assistance
            System Modernization Project : restructuring : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - Social Assistance System
            Modernization Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Assistance System
            Modernization Project seeks significant improvement of the
            effectiveness of Ukraine's social assistance system by
            better targeting the benefits and reducing the burden on
            beneficiaries. The closing date for the project will be
            extended from July 1, 2011 until January 1, 2013. The
            extension is necessary to: undertake the national roll-out
            of software for a Management Information System (MIS) that
            was designed, developed and tested under the project;
            migrate data from the old system to the new one; create main
            and back-up server offices for the registry; and undertake
            some training sessions and studies. The Project's
            implementation schedule and procurement plan have been
            revised and an action plan prepared to allow for completion
            of all activities by the new closing date. With the
            extension, it is fully expected that the project can be
            completed and meet its original objectives. There are no
            outstanding audit reports for this project. This will be the
            third extension of the project and will bring the cumulative
            extensions to 48 months.

display_title.display_title:
Ukraine - Social Assistance
            System Modernization Project : restructuring : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - Social Assistance System
            Modernization Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Assistance System
            Modernization Project seeks significant improvement of the
            effectiveness of Ukraine's social assistance system by
            better targeting the benefits and reducing the burden on
            beneficiaries. The project has made noteworthy progress in
            2008, which continued in 2009. The last supervision mission
            recorded significant progress in all three project
            components and the rating was upgraded. The project is now
            at a phase when different activities under the three
            components start fitting together, allowing the Project to
            achieve its overall objective. Given the extension, end of
            project target dates for achieving final results will be
            adjusted accordingly. The extension is necessary to complete
            ongoing management information system (MIS) related
            activities, which are a key to attaining the project
            development objective (PDO). The key milestones established
            as conditions for considering project extension have been
            met, particularly in terms of completion of civil works and
            development of the MIS. The project's implementation
            schedule has been revised to allow completing it by the
            proposed closing date. This revised schedule puts project
            activities into a tight timeframe and leaves no room for
            delays. Recent payment delays by the national treasury
            affected income tax (IT) contracts execution. Therefore, the
            team agreed to reduce the minimum application size for
            payments directly from the loan account from USD1.8 million
            to USD200,000 for a six month period and already
            communicated this decision to the Borrower. This reduction
            will accelerate payments under large IT contracts. This will
            be the second extension for the project. The first extension
            was for 17 month reflecting far too short implementation
            period for the project that covers introduction of the new
            client intake model in more than 750 local welfare offices
            all over Ukraine. The second extension will bring the
            project's cumulative extensions to 30 months and the
            overall project implementation period to five years.

display_title.display_title:
Ukraine - Social Assistance
            System Modernization Project : restructuring : Main report
